result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob T. Boushon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond applied from this case and from 15CM37

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob T. Boushon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Jacob T. Boushon appeared, pro se  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Jacob T. Boushon appeared, pro se  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 11-17-2015 11:30 am.
Status conference at 11-19-2015 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Additionally, defendant may possess prescription drugs only when prescribed by a medical professional for the defendant, which shall be taken as prescribed.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
